_children.body: Among cellulose, poly(vinyl chloride), nylon and natural rubber, the polymer in which the intermolecular force of attraction is weakest is
_children.explanation:
Natural rubber is an elastomer in which the chains are held together by weak van der Waals forces of attraction. Cellulose and nylon are fibres and PVC is a thermoplastic. Both these classes of polymers have stronger forces of attraction in the order

Fibre > Thermoplastic > Elastomer.
